revised_title: Production of Induced Radioactivity by High Velocity Protons and Diplons
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to produce induced radioactivity by bombarding carbon with protons and diplons, and in boron and possibly nitrogen with diplons. They studied the decay periods of the radioactive bodies and the energy distribution of the positive electrons. Their findings contribute to the understanding of the nature of radioactive isotopes and the potential applications of particle acceleration in nuclear physics.
